Title: Post office to end Saturday mail service
Summary: The Postal Service is planning to drop Saturday delivery of first-class mail, a congressional source said this morning.

Title: Boy Scouts are expected to address gay ban
Summary: IRVING, Texas — Boy Scouts of America officials are expected to announce Wednesday whether they will lift a national ban on gay leaders and members, instead giving local scouting groups the power to decide.

Title: Arias' Boyfriend Had 'Bill Clinton' View of Sex
Summary: Accused murderer Jodi Arias testified today that her ex-boyfriend, Travis Alexander, had a 'Bill Clinton view of sex,' eager for oral and anal sex to get around Mormon church rules against premarital sex. Arias' remark came on her second day on the stand while describing, often in detail, what she said were the sexual demands by Alexander in the early days of their tumultuous affair that ended when she stabbed and shot Alexander to death.

Title: Defensive players head USF recruiting class
Duke students protest frat's 'racist rager' party
Summary: Students at Duke University in Durham, N.C., were gathering Wednesday to protest anti-Asian prejudice after a fraternity hosted a 'racist rager' party last week replete with literature that lampooned Asian students.

Title: California tour bus crash death toll rises to 8
Summary: Grisly mountain road crash claims pickup-truck driver struck head-on by bus going to Mexico

Title: Boy Scouts delay decision on admitting gays
Summary: A decision on whether the Boy Scouts of America will keep its policy that excludes gay members and leaders will not be voted on until the organization's annual meeting in May, the national executive board said Wednesday.

Title: Texas prison escapee caught after 16 years

Title: Obama Orders Release of Drone Memos to Lawmakers
Summary: The Justice Department will send to Congress classified documents on the legal justification for the use of drones in targeting American citizens abroad who are deemed terrorists.
